sentences.sContent: She was a splendid mimic and loved to imitate Winston Churchill.
sentences.sCn: 她是个出色的模仿者，喜欢模仿温斯顿·丘吉尔。

sentences.sContent: ...cities across the country imitate the walkability and transit-oriented development making cities like New York and San Francisco so successful...
...But by doing his best to imitate Mr Jobs...

remMethod.val: im ＋ it(它) ＋ ate(吃) → 它照着别人的样子吃 → 模仿

trans.tranOther: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh
